prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system with the following: * A rectangle with four lines: 1. Line 1: start point [0.0, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.0] 2. Line 2: start point [0.75, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.25] 3. Line 3: start point [0.75, 0.25], end point [0.0, 0.25] 4. Line 4: start point [0.0, 0.25], end point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch with a factor of 0.75 and create a 3D sketch by applying the transformation from the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch with the following specifications: * Extrusion depth towards the normal: 0.0 * Extrusion depth opposite the normal: 0.5 * Sketch scale: 0.75 Apply the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" to complete the creation of the first part, resulting in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.5 * Height: 0.75 Part 2: Construction of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.75, 0.0, 0.125]. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system with the following: * A smaller rectangle with four lines: 1. Line 1: start point [0.0, 0.0], end point [0.125, 0.0] 2. Line 2: start point [0.125, 0.0], end point [0.125, 0.125] 3. Line 3: start point [0.125, 0.125], end point [0.0, 0.125] 4. Line 4: start point [0.0, 0.125], end point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch with a factor of 0.125 and create a 3D sketch by applying the transformation from the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch with the following specifications: * Extrusion depth towards the normal: 0.0 * Extrusion depth opposite the normal: 0.625 * Sketch scale: 0.125 Apply the "CutFeatureOperation" to the current part. This will remove the specified material from the previous part, resulting in a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.625 * Width: 0.125 * Height: 0.125 Part 3: Construction of a second rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.75, 0.375, 0.125]. Follow the same process as with Part 2, but with the following coordinates for the smaller rectangle in the sketch: * Line 1: start point [0.0, 0.0], end point [0.125, 0.0] * Line 2: start point [0.125, 0.0], end point [0.125, 0.125] * Line 3: start point [0.125, 0.125], end point [0.0, 0.125] * Line 4: start point [0.0, 0.125], end point [0.0, 0.0] Apply the "CutFeatureOperation" to the current part. The result is a second rectangular prism with the same dimensions as the one in Part 2. The final shape will have a different overall configuration due to the combination of all parts.</description>
